Key Match Events: New Zealand chased down 79 in 12.2 overs to win by seven wickets.
Papua New Guinea bowled out for 78 off 19.4 overs.
Kiwi fast bowler Ferguson claimed three wickets without conceding a run off his four overs.
Post-Match Reflections: New Zealand captain Kane Williamson expressed satisfaction with the team's performance, highlighting the challenging conditions and the importance of adapting quickly.
Williamson also reflected on the contributions of older players like Trent Boult, who played his last game in the format for New Zealand.
Papua New Guinea captain Assad Vala acknowledged the learnings from the game, especially in batting, and expressed hope for future improvements.
Player of the match Lockie Ferguson commented on the tough batting conditions and expressed disappointment at heading home despite the win.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Both sides were already eliminated from Super 8s contention.
Trent Boult's last game in the format for New Zealand, with potential for more retirements from the ageing Black Cap side.
